title: Halliburton profit falls 32% on weak North America drilling
text:
Halliburton profit falls 32% on weak North America drilling

Stock Markets 33 minutes ago (Oct 21, 2019 06:58AM ET)

(Reuters) - Oilfield services provider Halliburton Co (N: ) reported a 32% slump in quarterly profit on Monday, hit by a slowdown in shale drilling in North America, its biggest market. Net profit attributable to Halliburton fell to $295 million, or 34 cents per share, in the third quarter ended Sept. 30, from $435 million, or 50 cents per share, a year earlier. Revenue fell 10% to $5.55 billion.

Halliburton profit falls 32% on weak North America drilling
description: Halliburton profit falls 32% on weak North America drilling
